titleStmt.title: England's joyful welcome to the King, upon his return to White-Hall, on the 16th. of December, 1688. after his withdrawing himself, and 6 days absence. Or, The loyal subjects delight To the tune of, Why are my eyes flowing, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Dennisson, at the Stationers-Arms, within Aldgate,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Now, now let's rejoyce, and let England be glad,".
Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
